parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of tools used to make the split (see Remarks ) VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

title: ISplitLineFeatureData.ISetSplitTools
description: Sets the tools used to make the split.
signature:
void ISetSplitTools( 
   System.Int32
Count
,
   ref System.Object
DispArr
)

parameters.name: Count
parameters.description: Number of tools used to make the split

parameters.name: DispArr
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of tools used to make the split (see Remarks ) VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

remarks:
Reference planes
,
planar model faces
, and
bodies
are valid tools for a split.
See
Accessing Selections that Define Features
for additional details.
